questions.question: What are the names of the two C2H6-selective MOFs designed for ethylene purification under humid conditions?
questions.answer: NKMOF-14-PZ and NKMOF-14-PD

questions.question: What is the significance of the (3,9)-connected xmz topology in the design of NKMOF-14-PZ and NKMOF-14-PD?
questions.answer: The (3,9)-connected xmz topology contributes to the robustness and high stability of the MOFs, making them suitable for gas separation applications under humid conditions.

questions.question: How do NKMOF-14-PZ and NKMOF-14-PD demonstrate selectivity towards C2H6 over C2H4?
questions.answer: NKMOF-14-PZ and NKMOF-14-PD demonstrate selectivity towards C2H6 over C2H4 due to their pore size, high surface areas, and the presence of affinity sites that preferentially adsorb C2H6 molecules.

questions.question: What role do the trinuclear Fe building blocks play in the design of NKMOF-14-PZ and NKMOF-14-PD?
questions.answer: The trinuclear Fe building blocks are chosen to construct MOFs with high stability, contributing to the MOFs' robustness and suitability for gas separation application under humid conditions.

questions.question: Why is it important for NKMOF-14-PZ and NKMOF-14-PD to have low water uptake at high humidity?
questions.answer: Low water uptake at high humidity minimizes the influence of moisture on separation properties, allowing efficient separation of C2H6/C2H4 under humid conditions.

questions.question: True or False: NKMOF-14-PZ and NKMOF-14-PD possess open metal sites.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: True or False: The C2H6 uptake of NKMOF-14-PZ at 298 K is the highest among all reported C2H6-selective MOFs.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What experimental technique was used to confirm the trapping of C2H6 and C2H4 gas molecules in the MOF channels?
questions.answer: Fourier transform infrared (FTIR) spectroscopy was used to confirm the trapping of C2H6 and C2H4 gas molecules in the MOF channels.

questions.question: How do NKMOF-14-PZ and NKMOF-14-PD maintain their structural integrity under various harsh conditions?
questions.answer: NKMOF-14-PZ and NKMOF-14-PD maintain their structural integrity due to their ultrahigh chemical and thermal stability, which allows them to withstand conditions like boiling water, acidic/basic solutions, and high temperatures.

questions.question: True or False: The breakthrough experiments for C2H6/C2H4 separation were only conducted under dry conditions.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What is the role of the hydrophobic pore environments in NKMOF-14-PZ and NKMOF-14-PD?
questions.answer: The hydrophobic pore environments minimize competitive adsorption between water and hydrocarbons, enhancing the MOFs' efficiency in separating C2H6/C2H4 under humid conditions.

questions.question: True or False: NKMOF-14-PZ and NKMOF-14-PD can be recycled for at least five cycles without any degradation of separation efficiency.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What is the significance of the BET surface areas being 1561 m2 g-1 for NKMOF-14-PZ and 1449 m2 g-1 for NKMOF-14-PD?
questions.answer: The high BET surface areas of NKMOF-14-PZ and NKMOF-14-PD are beneficial for obtaining high C2H6 adsorption capacity and C2H4 productivity, contributing to their efficiency in gas separation.

questions.question: True or False: The separation performance of NKMOF-14-PZ and NKMOF-14-PD decreases significantly under humid conditions.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: How do NKMOF-14-PZ and NKMOF-14-PD compare to other reported C2H6-selective MOFs in terms of separation performance under humid conditions?
questions.answer: NKMOF-14-PZ and NKMOF-14-PD exhibit superior comprehensive separation performance (both C2H6 uptake and selectivity) under humid conditions compared to other reported C2H6-selective MOFs, making them the best materials for separating ethane and ethylene under such conditions.

questions.question: True or False: The C2H6/C2H4 separation performance of NKMOF-14-PZ and NKMOF-14-PD is verified by computational studies only.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What is the role of the trinuclear Fe clusters coordinating with N-donor ligands in the design of NKMOF-14-PZ and NKMOF-14-PD?
questions.answer: The trinuclear Fe clusters coordinating with N-donor ligands contribute to the preferential adsorption of ethane and hydrophobicity of the MOFs, enhancing their efficiency in C2H6/C2H4 separation.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesis of NKMOF-14-PZ and NKMOF-14-PD involves the use of open metal sites to achieve high stability.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What experimental results confirm the trapping of C2H6 and C2H4 gas molecules in NKMOF-14-PZ and NKMOF-14-PD?
questions.answer: The trapping of C2H6 and C2H4 gas molecules in NKMOF-14-PZ and NKMOF-14-PD is confirmed by Fourier transform infrared (FTIR) spectroscopy, which detected characteristic stretching vibrations of the gas molecules.

questions.question: True or False: The design of NKMOF-14-PZ and NKMOF-14-PD incorporates electrically charged frameworks to enhance gas separation performance.
questions.answer: False
